column4: why does df /boot not give me a partition with /boot? it gives me one with just /
did you actually set a separate /boot though? There's none by default.
I don't know. I'm trying to fix grub since it broke my linux and windows partition.
fdisk -l output to paste.ubuntu.com please.... also /boot/grub/menu.lst
strange... but ok... can I see your /boot/grub/menu.lst also please?
see the title Windows 95/98/NT/2000 example? you want to use that... but set it to (hd0,2) ... remove the #'s infront too.
editing the file from my linux partition will keep the changes? editing it from grub didn't.
ok, thanks. I'll take a look.
Why are you wanting to use XMMS? Try audacious maybe? (fork of old xmms)
because I don't know how to find the good apps. I'll try that one.
Thanks. This thing is more like WinAmp. I can actually play files instead of having to navigate through ID3 tags of every single song I have.
XAMPP sounds like its X-based LAMP... there is an apache configuration tool that would make it easier, but just dive in if you know what you're doing
